text:
BiGS is the shorthand form for
the Institute for the Study
of Business in Global Society.

We launched with the goal
of looking at all the areas

in which business overlaps
with and occasionally collides

with society, and trying to
think in new and creative ways

about what the role of
business can and perhaps should

be in addressing some of
society's greatest challenges.

Whether it's the pandemic or
racial injustice or growing

inequality and the looming
threat of climate change,

the world just
seems to be dealing

with a whole host of complex,
multifaceted, multilayered
problems.

We are at a moment in time
where business as usual
will not solve the problem.

Little incremental steps
will not solve the problem.

How does the corporation become
an engine of economic growth
and progress for society?

What is the future role of
the corporation and leaders
within corporations?

We all, as humans, want to
be associated with brands,

with organizations
that are having
a meaningfully positive impact.

What we're seeing just
in the last five years

is a marked increase in the
degree to which consumers,

employees, citizens
would like business

to weigh into the big
issues of our time.

But if they're going to weigh
in, then do something about it.

And so it's a real challenge
for business leaders.

They don't necessarily know
how to think about their role

in driving
socioeconomic equality.

They want to do something
about racial injustice,

but that's not something
that's been in the playbook
up until this point.

We see our role as trying to
help these business leaders

and giving them new ways of
thinking about and operating

in accordance with the
new sets of demands that
are being placed upon them.

I think at HBS,
we have a big role

to play in actually
doing both research,

but also, through our teaching,
understanding how leaders

can develop the
management, the governance

skills, the analytical
skills, the leadership skills

in order to be able to drive
both purpose and profit
inside organizations.

I would like to see us do
more in the way of being

a convening place for
companies, leaders who

are interested in making change,
creating opportunities for them

to talk to each other,
to learn from each other.

Our hope is to be very
bold and very ambitious.

We have a war to
save the planet.

We have a war to address
longstanding inequalities.

And HBS can play a role
in training the folks

and educating the folks
who will go out and be
part of that effort.
